sentences.en: As the air rises it becomes colder and moisture condenses out of it.
sentences.cn: 随着空气上升，其温度降低，凝结出水分。

sentences.en: Gasoline vapor also condenses on cold engine parts and drips down into oil pan.
sentences.cn: 汽油蒸气会凝结在冷的发动机零件上,然后流入油底壳.

sentences.en: If steam touches cold surfaces, it condenses into water.
sentences.cn: 如果蒸汽接触冷的表面, 它就会凝结成水.

sentences.en: In the condenser, hot steam condenses into liquid, the trickle - down pipeline.
sentences.cn: 在冷凝器里, 炽热的蒸汽凝结成液体, 滴入管道.

sentences.en: Soup condenses when boiled, ie by losing most of the water.
sentences.cn: 汤煮过后就浓了(失去大量的水分).

sentences.en: Steam condenses / is condensed into water when it touches a cold surface.
sentences.cn: 蒸气接触冷的表面而凝结成水珠.

sentences.en: Steam condenses into drops of water.
Steam condenses into water when it cools.
Steam condenses to water when it touches a cold surface.
sentences.cn: 水蒸气触及冷的表面即凝结成水.

sentences.en: The cold wind condenses vapor into rain.
sentences.cn: 冷风使水蒸气凝结成雨.

sentences.en: The compressed gas is cooled and condenses into a liquid.
sentences.cn: 压缩气体经冷却凝结成液态。

sentences.en: The steam is therefore cooled, and it condenses back to water.
sentences.cn: 蒸汽因而得到冷却, 并凝结成水.

sentences.en: Water vapour condenses to form clouds.
When water vapour changes to water, we say that it condenses.
sentences.cn: 当水蒸气变成水时, 我们把它叫做冷凝.

sentences.en: When you summarize, you condense an extended idea or argument into a sentence or more in your own words.
sentences.cn: 总结的时候，用自己的话把拓展了的观念或论据简缩成一句或几句话。

trans.tran_cn: 浓缩，（使）变稠或变浓，浓缩( condense的第三人称单数 )，（使）凝结，简说，摘要，简述
trans.tran_en: If you condense something, especially a piece of writing or a speech, you make it shorter, usually by including only the most important parts
